item.title: 'Every day is so special with you': Bindi Irwin celebrates her anniversary with boyfriend Chandler Powell in a loved-up social media tribute
item.description: Bindi Irwin and Chandler Powell have celebrated their four-and-a-half year anniversary in typically loved-up fashion.
item.content:encoded:
Bindi Irwin and Chandler Powell have celebrated their four-and-a-half year anniversary in typically loved-up fashion.

On Wednesday, Bindi, 19, sent Chandler, 21, a romantic Instagram tribute to mark the special occasion.

The daughter of Terri and late Australian icon Steve Irwin shared an image that showed her cuddling her boyfriend on the grounds of Australia Zoo.

'I have loved this guy since I first met him, over four and a half years ago,' she wrote.

'Every day is so special with you.'

The post attracted an astonishing 11,000 plus likes in under an hour.

Chandler and Bindi met at Australia Zoo and have previously discussed the story of their fateful encounter.

'I'm a professional wakeboarder. I was there (Australia) for a wakeboard competition,' the American told Dancing With The Stars in 2015.

'We were stopping by the area where the zoo was so I thought it would be awesome to go visit Australia Zoo. And she ended up giving me a tour and we ended up staying in touch ever since.'

In an interview with US Weekly around the same time, Bindi recalled how much of a gentlemen Chandler was when he reached out to her.

'He tracked me down through the zoo and was like 'If she doesn't want to stay in contact that's totally fine, but here's my e-mail.'

'We stayed in touch and became great friends. I can't really say when it turned into more. It just evolved over time and bloomed into this wonderful thing.'

The daughter of Terri and late Australian icon Steve Irwin shared an image that showed her cuddling her boyfriend on the grounds of Australia Zoo.

item.title: Olivia Culpo flaunts side boob and legs in skimpy black mini dress on New York City streets
item.description: The former Miss Universe 2012 went bra-less in a revealing black coat mini dress flashing plenty of skin in the plunging number.
item.content:encoded:
Olivia Culpo showed off some major cleavage as she posed for the cameras in New York on Tuesday.

The former Miss Universe 2012 strutted her stuff on city streets as cameras clicked, before heading to an event at Saks Fifth Avenue to celebrate the opening of the store's new jewelry floor. 

Olivia, 26, made quite the impression at the event, which was hosted with Town & Country, going bra-less in a revealing black coat mini dress flashing plenty of skin in the plunging number.

Happily embracing the warmer months, Olivia went bare-legged in black stiletto heels, flaunting an expanse of leg in her short black dress.  

Adding to the cool girl look, Olivia wore the sleeves of her mini pushed up to the elbow, while her hair was tied back from her face.

The ex-beauty queen had her brows thickly penciled in, and her eyes were lined with lashings of black kohl. Her lips, meanwhile, were slicked with a dark rose lipstick.

Clearly keen to keep the summery spirit alive, Olivia happily showcased her look while posing in front of a flower wall at the event, turning this way and that so the cameras could take in every aspect of the trendy look.  

She was also pictured picking up some sparklers at Jewelry on 2, posing with a Saks carrier bag, while leaning provocatively on one of the many glass-topped jewelry cases in the store's newest area. 

The sighting came hours after she had walked the red carpet at the CFDA Fashion Awards in Brooklyn.

Her show style included a simple, yellow dress complete with a drop waist and tiny ruffle detailing.

The backless number showcased her figure and glowing skin.

item.title: Vicky Pattison says she is 'drowning in pain and grief' following sudden death of her best friend aged just 37
item.description: Following his shock passing, the star first broke her silence on Monday however returned to Instagram the following day
item.content:encoded:
Vicky Pattison has spoken out about her 'pain and grief' following the tragic death of her best friend Paul Burns aged just 37 on Saturday. 

Following his shock passing, the star first broke her silence on Monday however returned to Instagram the following day to share a montage of images with her 'oldest and best friend' alongside a heartbreaking caption. 

The devastating news spread on social media over the weekend with stars of Geordie Shore, including Charlotte Crosby and Kyle Christie, paying homage to the nightclub and events manager, as he was dubbed 'a beautiful human being'. 

Heartbroken Vicky took to Instagram on Monday to share a touching tribute to her 'best friend, oldest friend and one of the most amazing people', as she branded the past days 'a nightmare' in a heartbreaking message.

The star, who spent Paul's last evening with him on Friday, penned the next day: 'Grief is like an ocean, it comes in waves, ebbing and flowing...Sometimes the water is calm and sometimes it is overwhelming.

'All we can do is learn to swim... That’s how I feel now- overwhelmed and like I’m drowning in my own pain and grief. I’m not ready to accept the fact that we won’t laugh together again. I am not ready to believe you’re gone...

'The injustice of all of this is too much to bear and there’s nothing I wouldn’t give to be able to hear your voice again. We may have loved you Paul, but God loved you a lot more... I will think of you everyday my friend'. 

Vicky's Instagram has often been littered with snaps of Paul, and vice versa, and on Friday she took to the photosharing site to post an image as she celebrated Paul's birthday, while adding a sweet caption in tribute to her pal.

She penned: 'Celebrating this amazing ones birthday a little bit late but oh so well with the help of @dessertsdeliveredbakery!! This Nutella cake literally blew everyone away!! THANKYOU so much!! @mrpaulburns1- love you forever'. 

She waited two days before posting a tribute, as she penned: 'I don’t know what to post. I don’t know what to say. But this seemed fitting. you are my best friend, my oldest friend and one of the most amazing people in the world...

'My heart is broken. I know I will never get over losing you and this still doesn’t feel real- I’m desperately just waiting for the moment I wake up from this nightmare...

'The only solace I can take from this is that I spent your last night with you and all of our best friends and you knew how much we loved you. How important you were to us and how you kept us together as a group...

'I never met a more selfless person. Some of the best moments of my life I shared with you and the lasses. I do not want to accept that you won’t be at my wedding...

'The world will forever be less bright without you in it. But I suppose you were just too special. You were too good for us Paul and I hope they look after you in heaven. Show them how it’s done boot off burns'.

She attached the words to a quote reading: 'The reality is you will grieve forever. You will not 'get over' the loss of a loved one; you will earn to live with it. You will heal and you will rebuild yourself around the loss you have suffered.

'You will be whole again but you will never be the same again. Nor should you be the same, nor should you want to'.

It was revealed on Facebook on Monday that a candlelit vigil will be held in popular nightspot Tup Tup Palace on Thursday evening. 

Hours after her night out with him, news surfaced revealing he had died, as Charlotte took to Twitter to write: 'Today has just felt awful. Really really awful. This is just not right... RIP PB.'

She also took to Instagram to share a collage of images with Paul, while adding the touching caption: 'Words cannot describe the pain this weekend has brought It still doesn’t feel real. I don’t want it to be real. 

'I am so so so happy to be able to of shared some amazing memories with you that I will never ever forget. Without you Newcastle has lost its sparkle. My thoughts are with All of Paul’s family and best friends...RIP Paul burns....love you.' 

Her ex-flame and Gaz Beadle penned: 'I actually can’t believe I am reading this on Facebook. Paul ‘Conrad’ Burns RIP literally loved by everyone never not smiling... 

'One of the first people I met out and about in Newcastle and never let you go past him without a big smile and a hug. Honestly can’t believe it taken way to early.'

Her former co-star Kyle, shared a snap with Paul with the caption: 'I’ll always remember my first night out in town where you took me under your wing and made sure I was well looked after in night life trade that was 10 years ago.

'Heaven has definitely got one hell of a vip up there with you sorting it out love you brother till we meet again!'

Vicky's sister Laura Pattison shared a screenshot of her WhatsApp conversation with Paul from last month, in which he penned 'I love you more'. 

She added the caption: 'No darling I love you more.. I can't cope RIP my best friend paul life will never ever be the same without you. 

'Writing these words is making me sick I will never ever cope the same without you. Love you forever rest in peace my gorgeous best friend. Thank god I got to see you last night'. 

The general manager of his work place, The Botanist, where he was pictured with Vicky on Friday, released a statement reading: 'To do great things you have to be a great man, and this was Paul. He worked with a smile...

'A style that was infectious and passionate. He was Mr Newcastle no doubt, but he was also Mr Botanist. Also loyal and committed, Newcastle Botanist would not be where it is today without this amazing man’s talent and support.

'Paul genuinely touched the hearts of everyone he worked with and loved, and his huge personality and infectious smile will live on in all of us forever. The city has lost a true gent, one that will never be replaced.'

A statement from Newcastle nightspot, Bonbar read: 'Everyone at Bonbar is deeply saddened to hear of the passing of our old front of house team member Paul Burns.

'One of the nicest people to ever work for us and never went anywhere without the big grin on his face. You will be truly missed by everyone in Newcastle. RIP'.

Other Twitter users to wrote on the site: 'Spend life with those who make you happy, not who you have to impress'... Paul Burns... Absolutely gutted to hear the sad news, another wonderful person taken far too soon! 

'A face of Newcastle, it won’t be the same without you! RIP Paul 'Conrad' Burns... RIP Mr Paul burns. Gentleman always and forever... Along with the rest of Newcastle, I'm gutted to hear about Paul Burns. Such a lovely bloke, taken far too soon...

'RIP... What absolutely awful news!! R.I.P Paul burns! What a bloke and gentlemen. Sleep tight mate... RIP Paul Burns you beautiful human being.'

A representative for Vicky declined to comment when approached by MailOnline. The cause of death is unknown at time of publication.
item.dc:abstract: Vicky Pattison has spoken out about her 'pain and grief' following the tragic death of her best friend Paul Burns aged just 37 on Saturday. Following his shock passing, the star first broke her silence on Monday however returned to Instagram the following day to share a montage of images with her 'oldest and best friend' with a heartbreaking caption.

item.title: Nicole Scherzinger flashes the flesh in sheer top as she rocks pair of skintight black leather pants
item.description: She rose to fame as the lead singer of Pussycat Dolls. And Nicole Scherzinger every inch the pop sensation as she left little to the imagination leaving dinner in West Hollywood on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded:
She rose to fame as the lead singer of Pussycat Dolls.

And Nicole Scherzinger every inch the pop sensation as she left little to the imagination leaving dinner in West Hollywood on Tuesday.

The 39-year-old beauty showcased her ample assets in a revealing mesh top and skintight black leather jeans after a night at celeb hot spot Craig's.

Daring to impress, the darling diva thrust her ample cleavage on center stage as the top featured a plunging neckline.

Her gorgeous gams stole the spotlight as her leggings were form fitting while she stomped the streets in black high heels.

She kept her trademark raven tresses long and loose as they cascaded over her petite shoulders. 

Nicole's appearance in Los Angeles comes amid reports Simon Cowell has allegedly dropped the star from his panel on The X Factor.

A source told The Sun: 'Nicole was a passionate judge but has no contract and won't be back this year in order to bring in fresh blood.'

An X Factor spokesperson told MailOnline: 'There is always speculation regarding the judging panel. It's too early to confirm the judges for the next series.'

Following on from this, sources hinted that her co-stars Sharon Osbourne and Louis Walsh would remain on the judging panel, as ITV refused to pay out the remainder of their fees for terminating their contracts early. 

A source told The Mail On Sunday: 'Louis and Sharon have to stay. Both made it clear they were going nowhere and they would fight for their jobs.

'Not only would the cost to get rid of them run into several million, so would the stars who would take over. It is just not a feasible option, they will be back alongside Simon.'

item.title: Va-va voom! Tziporah Malkah, 44, can't keep the smile off her face as she shows off her INCREDIBLE transformation at a book launch in Sydney
item.description: Tziporah Malkah, 44, looked absolutely incredible as she showed off a huge smile at a book launch in Sydney on Wednesday.
item.content:encoded:
Tziporah Malkah was one of the world's top models, living a life of luxury before she lost millions and ended up in a homeless shelter.

But after several years of turmoil, it seems the star is back to her bubbly best.

The 44-year-old looked absolutely sensational as she stepped out for a book launch in Sydney on Wednesday, brandishing a huge smile upon her face.

Having made no secret of her conservative political views, Tzipoprah looked to be in her element at the launch of the right-wing tome How Political Correctness Is Destroying Australia.

The beauty hobnobbed with former Prime Minister Tony Abbott and radio king Alan Jones at the VIP event.

At one point, Tziporah was even spotted snapping selfies with Married At First Sight star Tracey Jewel, who also showed up at the launch. 

Both brunettes are represented by Sydney publicist Max Markson.  

Appearing to have slimmed down, Tziporah looked nothing short of sensational in a grape coloured jacket.

However, she later shed the outerwear, seen in a black cardigan that was cut low to reveal a hint of her lace bra.

The rambunctious beauty bore a striking resemblance to Nigella Lawson - the busty British cook who is regarded as one of the sexiest women in the world.

And on her Instagram page, Tziporah shared a number of photos from the book launch, and was promptly met with adoring comments from fans.

'You look so beautiful! one admirer wrote. 

'Looking lovely!' another cooed.

Tziporah has recently relocated back to Sydney, after a year living in Adelaide. 

The star lived in the southern city with Guy Vasey before their relationship came to a dramatic end.

Tziporah was charged with assaulting Guy, although she escaped conviction during a court appearance last month.
item.dc:abstract: Tziporah Malkah was one of the world's top models, living a life of luxury before she lost her millions and ended up in a homeless shelter. But after several years of turmoil, it seems the star is back to her bubbly best. The 44-year-old looked absolutely sensational as she stepped out for a book launch in Sydney on Wednesday, appearing happy and relaxed as she brandished a huge smile upon her face.

item.title: America's Got Talent: Simon Cowell hits golden buzzer for devoted father and singer Michael Ketterer
item.description: A moving tale of fatherly love preceded an astonishing performance that won Simon Cowell's coveted golden buzzer on Tuesday's episode of America's Got Talent.
item.content:encoded:
A moving tale of fatherly love preceded an astonishing performance that won Simon Cowell's coveted golden buzzer on Tuesday's episode of America's Got Talent.

When pediatric mental health nurse Michael Ketterer nervously took to the stage, he seemed to be like many others saying: 'My family is my reason I'm here.'

He soon told the amazing tale of how he almost lost his wife and daughter, with 'signs' later leading them to adopting five sons — three rescued from a squalid meth lab, one who was homeless, and another with cerebral palsy.

'My children came out of foster care, and when you're surviving you can't dream,' he told the judges, getting a huge sigh from the audience.

'That has been one of the most rewarding things — providing them with a home and a safe environment where they're free to dream.

'So I'm here because I want to show them that if their dad can live out his dreams then nothing's impossible for them.'

Michael then started singing To Love Somebody — stunning the room with his beautiful voice and a performance clearly driven by the words of devotion for his family.

The heartfelt performance left many in tears, including some of his children watching in the wings.

'That was absolutely amazingly incredible,' Mel B told him, adding: 'You sing from your soul. ...Thank you for gracing this stage, thank you. Seriously.'

Heidi Klum, 45, said she was 'blown away,' while Howie Mandel told Michael: 'I feel when I'm listening to you and watching you I just want to be a fraction of the human being that I believe that you are. You're a great performer, and you're a star human being.'

Simon, 58, struggled to contain his emotions as he called Michael 'real,' smiling as he said 'sometimes actions speak louder than words' — standing to press the golden buzzer sending him straight through to the live rounds.

After jumping for joy, Michael's wife and kids joined him for hugs onstage, with Simon also going up to meet them all, telling Michael: 'What a fantastic audition. Something about your voice, I genuinely mean this, is special and everything was perfect.'

In moving pre-recorded interviews, Michael told how his wife Ivy almost died giving birth to their first child, saying: 'The doctor came out and basically told me the woman that I love the most in life and my new daughter, they probably wouldn't make it through the night. I spent the whole night just praying.'

They survived but were warned if they tried to have more children 'this would happen again.'

After seven years of it being just the three of them, he said his daughter started having dreams where three boys needed adopting, smiling as he recalled: 'It took her two years to convince us to adopt.'

'After we went through the process of getting certified to adopt, our very first call that we got was for these little boys,' he said, admitting how incredible it seemed as he laughed: 'I promise I'm not making any of this up!'

He explained: 'They were being raised in this horrific environment. There was a meth lab in the home, they didn't have running water or power, and the youngest, because he was so hungry, had filled his stomach with gravel.

'He jumped into my arms and said, ''Are you my new daddy?'' And I said ''Well you can call me that if you want to.'' And he said, ''Ok, I want to call you Daddy.'' And that was the beginning of these three boys in our home.'

They then took in another child who was homeless, thinking they were done — with Michael then saying he demanded 'a sign' when another call came for a child with cerebral palsy.

'I got in a car and they had just put up this big billboard and it was the man who had just pushed his son through marathons with cerebral palsy,' he recalled.

'And I just broke down because I was like, ''You literally just gave me a sign that this little boy is my son.''

And he admitted that the final addition to the family played a big part on him being on the AGT stage, saying: 'Me and Rodrigo have a special bond because he absolutely loves music and I love to sing and make music.'

He added: 'Every dad likes to think that they're a hero to their kids. I think like America's Got Talent could absolutely change my family's life.'

The night's other emotional highlight came from another singer with a powerful backstory, with Christina Wells, 42, telling how she gave up her initial dreams of stardom at 19 after getting told she was turned down for an audition 'because I wasn't the right size.'

'I am fat — I am — it's not an opinion,' she cried to camera, saying 'it confirmed my greatest insecurities,' adding: 'So I stopped singing.'

But she said she was compelled to come on the show to show her two sons 'that nothing — nothing — should prevent you from making your dreams come true.'

The registered nurse burst into tears when she got a huge standing ovation after her performance of Queen Latifah's I Know Where I've Been, with Howie telling her: 'You just blew your cork off and exploded with what you've been doing your whole life! We felt your soul.'

Mel B, 43, then told her: 'Don't let anybody's comments stop you from being you because you are beautiful. And what a voice!'

Simon, meanwhile, insisted he first started shows like America's Got Talent 'because I worked with so many stupid people in the music business,' asking: ''Who actually thinks somebody's gonna buy a song because of somebody's weight? It is ridiculous.

'The real greats, you don't think about how much they weigh, what they look like, they're just amazing, bloody fantastic singers.

'And you're one of those people.'

Two brothers, meanwhile, gave a powerful lesson in refusing to give up — getting through to the next round despite a fall during their amazing acrobatic act.

The Spanish duo Fratelli Rossi were already taking a huge risk by making their first performance after one of the brothers had recovered from ACL surgery on his knee.

The crowd went wild for their circus act where one brother used his feet to repeatedly spin his sibling on top of him — until he slipped and crashed, with Mel asking in a panic: 'Did he break it again?'

Mel and Howie, 62, passionately tried to persuade them to stop, but the brothers insisting on restarting — getting huge applause as they finished the act this time, with the brother balancing triumphantly on the other's feet at the end.

'The fact that it went wrong and then you went again actually made the act even better,' Simon told them. 'I was really on the edge of my seat.'

As they got four yeses to get through, Mel purred: 'I found that absolutely terrifying — but also hot. You're proper, like, men — I like that.'

Other acts who fell did not have it so good, with the judges joking that there were so many mishaps because it was season 13.

'I think there's a good chance if we say yes you'll probably die in the next round,' Simon told one acrobat who kept falling during a trampoline-and-basketball act, also telling another group of acrobats: 'It was so badly rehearsed — so many people almost died. I'm doing you a favor by saying no.'

Howie was relieved one act did not have a mishap after Aaron Crow dragged him onstage for the scariest performance of the evening.

The 49-year-old danger artist from Bruges, Belgium, who first appeared on Britain's Got Talent back in 2013, stunned everyone when he poured hot wax on his eyes to seal them — then wrapped tape and foil around his head to be completely blindfolded.

He then put a pineapple on Howie's head, leaving the judge repeatedly screaming 'No!' as he pulled out a sword — and accurately cut it in half, leaving the funnyman unscathed, at least physically, as he fell to his knees in shock.

'You're walking a little funny, did you poo poo in your pants a little bit?' Heidi asked Howie, who joked: 'You know what people are going to be saying tomorrow? How much of an idiot is Howie Mandel.'

'I've got to tell you, that takes balls — I wouldn't have done that,' Simon told his friend, adding: 'That was a great act but I think it was even better that you nearly killed Howie. I mean literally, you were two inches away from being dead there.'

All four sent them through, with Mel telling him: 'You're mysterious, you had everyone engaged — and you're hot.'

Arguably the most unexpected performance was Cuban husband-and-wife Celina, 64, and Filiberto, 70 — who broke into a dirty dancing routine that had Mel hiding her face behind her hands and buzzing for them to leave, complaining: 'Some things should just be done in private!'

It also sparked the most cutting comment of the night, with Howie joking of Mel and her bitter divorce battle: 'I'll just be honest with you, her last relationship hasn't worked out and when she sees this…'

The others loved the act, Ganas Con Canas, with Heidi saying of the couple: 'I pray I'm going to be that lucky when I get old to find someone to do that with, I really do.'

'I like things I get surprised by. You surprised me,' Simon told them.

The act that most divided the judges was Japanese duo Yumbo Dump, two Japanese friends who took off their shirts and made a series of funny sound with the help of their bellies.

Simon told them: 'This is one of the funniest things, and most stupid things, I've seen on this show. And you two are hilarious!'

'I think I was watching a completely different show,' Mel insisted to boos, having already buzzed for them to leave, but getting outvoted by the others.

'I didn't laugh and I really didn't get it,' said the former Spice Girls star.

Howie, meanwhile, was at odds over husband-and-wife singing duo Us The Duo, with Michael and Carissa Alvarado performing a song they wrote as wedding vows.

Howie got boos as he called the song 'a little coffee house' and said it was too risky performing self-written material on the show.

'I don't agree,' Simon snapped. 'The fact that you did something original makes you stand out, we're going to remember you. This is a really good audition.'

Howie was outvoted, with Heidi telling the couple: 'It made me all mushy and gushy inside because you two are so cute and in love and I can see the sparks flying. I think you have a hit right there.'

Lilly Wilker, 11, known as Rooster Roo, amazed everyone with her amazing animal impressions, constantly cracking up into giggles of her own during her act.

'That was fantastic!' Simon told her, also calling her 'possibly the nicest contestant we've ever had' when she said she would donate the $1 million prize money to hospitals and animal shelters if she were to win.  

'I think America is absolutely gonna fall in love with you, I do, you're so much fun,' Simon added.

Japanese diabolo juggler Yusaku Mochisuki, 29, also won over the judges, with Simon admitting: 'I think a big reason why this went down so well is your personality, Mochi — you're so much fun.'

His act saw spectacular lights on the wall based around his juggling, with Howie saying: 'When you think you've seen absolutely everything, and then there's a Mochi and you realize you ain't seen nothing yet.'

Hip hop dance crew Da RepubliK had been in tears describing growing up in poverty in the Dominican Republic, with the female leader saying: 'There is no such thing as the American dream in our country, that doesn't really exist. We just get to see it in movies, y'know?'

They had more tears after their huge ovation — and even more at getting through to the next round, with Howie calling it 'pure amazing brilliance in dance.'

While most acts try to flatter the judges, comedian Alex Hooper bizarrely went the complete opposite way — getting buzzed off by Howie, Mel and Heidi after telling spiteful jokes about them.

After telling Howie he looked like a big toe and saying there are no talented people in his native Canada, he turned on Mel and her persona as Scary Spice, saying: 'The only thing scary about you was your solo career.'

Then with Heidi, he joked: 'You are magical — four children and yet your body looks like you haven't paid attention to any of them.'

The audience booed throughout, also giving him the thumbs down — and only perked up when it came time to be cruel to Simon.

But Simon laughed along as Alex asked: 'Didn't we form this country to get away from Brits like you?'

He then thanked Simon for 'fixing your British teeth,' saying: 'Those things are so straight and white they were just offered positions in Trump's cabinet.'

Mel eventually went over and pressed Simon's buzzer for him to stop the act, sending him home.

Simon still insisted: 'Can I be honest with you? I think you're really funny. You did make me laugh, even the jokes about me.'

America's Got Talent returns next week on NBC.
item.dc:abstract: A moving tale of fatherly love preceded an astonishing performance that won Simon Cowell's coveted golden buzzer on Tuesday's episode of America's Got Talent. When pediatric mental health nurse Michael Ketterer nervously took to the stage, he seemed to be like many others saying: 'My family is my reason I'm here.' He soon told the amazing tale of how he almost lost his wife and daughter, with 'signs' later leading them to adopting five sons — three rescued from a squalid meth lab, one who was homeless, and another with cerebral palsy.
item.dc:creator: Paul Chavez
item.mi:shortTitle: America's Got Talent: Simon Cowell hits golden buzzer for singing dad

item.title: Kourtney Kardashian shows off her incredible figure in skimpy cut-out blazer dress in NYC
item.description: She is one of the most recognizable women in the country. And Kourtney Kardashian, 39, cut a sizzling figure when she enjoyed a swank evening out in New York City of a Tuesday evening.
item.content:encoded:
She is one of the most recognizable women in the country.

And Kourtney Kardashian, 39, cut a sizzling figure when she enjoyed an evening out in New York City on Tuesday.

She flashed a bit of her lacy black bra in a skimpy blazer dress when she was glimpsed emerging from Ralph Lauren's Polo Bar in Midtown Manhattan.

Kourtney's outfit featured holes carved out at each side, emphasizing the enviably preserved mother-of-three's chiseled midriff.

The eldest child of Kris Jenner wore her dark hair down, swinging along a sleek black purse and matching it with knee-high black leather boots.

Kourtney's children were sired by her ex Scott Disick.

The publicly amicable co-parents welcomed Mason in 2009, Penelope into the world in 2012, and Kourtney gave birth to her youngest child, Reign, in 2014.

Kourtney and Scott, who were introduced in 2006 by Girls Gone Wild founder Joe Francis in Mexico, last ended their romantic relationship in July of 2015.

They are now each dating someone more than a decade younger - Kourtney has a 25-year-old Algerian model toyboy called Younes Bendjima, while Scott, 35, is with Lionel Richie's 19-year-old daughter Sofia.

Scott is said to have parted ways from his teenage girlfriend recently, but the two are very obviously back together now.

This week, Sofia posted a social media snap of herself and Scott embracing on a plane, writing over the photo in white typescript: 'Whole [heart emoji].'

In April, Kourtney's little sister Khloe became a mother when she welcomed her daughter True with her allegedly cheating boyfriend Tristan Thompson.
item.dc:abstract: She is one of the most recognizable women in the country. And Kourtney Kardashian, 39, cut a sizzling figure when she enjoyed a swank evening out in New York City of a Tuesday evening. She flashed a bit of her lacy black bra in a skimpy navy blazer dress when she was glimpsed emerging from Ralph Lauren's Polo Bar in Midtown Manhattan.

item.title: A beauty in burgundy! Toni Collette slips into a dainty lace frock as she attends screening of her new thriller Hereditary in New York
item.description: The Australian actress, 45, slipped into a lovely lace burgundy frock as she posed with her co-stars at the Metrograph movie theatre.
item.content:encoded:
She looked lovely in a quirky cream frock as she stepped out for meetings earlier in the day. 

And Toni Collette turned heads again on Tuesday evening as she attended a screening for her new thriller, Hereditary.

The Australian star, 45, slipped into a lovely lace burgundy frock as she posed with her co-stars at the Metrograph movie theatre.

The acclaimed actress also wore eye-catching accessories, including a pair of embellished sandals and a large turquoise ring. 

The ageless beauty had her blonde locks coiffed in a casual low slung bun and applied smouldering makeup to her visage, including a copper toned smokey eye. 

Earlier in the day, Toni was spotted heading out to meetings in a more casual dress. 

The actress complemented her demure ensemble with a wide selection of jewellery, rocking a pair of gold hoop earrings, a gold necklace, a selection of bangles, and a number of rings.

Keeping things low-key, she paired her look with some comfortable white sneakers.

The last week has seen Toni earn critical acclaim for her performance in the upcoming movie.

Starring alongside Gabriel Byrne and The Handmaid's Tale star Ann Dowd, Toni plays Annie, a celebrated miniaturist who lives with her husband and two children in a rambling pile in Utah.

After the passing of her estranged mother, the family is plagued by creepy occurrences.

As the supernatural menace becomes worse, Annie fears she's losing her mind as she struggles to keep her family together.

The Australian actress' performance is already earning her buzz as an early Oscar front-runner.
item.dc:abstract: She looked lovely in a quirky cream frock as she stepped out for meetings earlier in the day. And Toni Colette turned heads again that evening as she attended a screening for her new thriller, Hereditary. The Australian star, 45, slipped into a lovely lace burgundy frock as she posed with her co-stars at the Metrograph movie theatre.

item.title: He's a very lucky man! Shanina Shaik shows off her endless legs in a sexy black leather mini skirt and daring shoulder cut top as she and husband DJ Ruckus host party in New York
item.description: She's no stranger at turning heads with her enviable figure and impeccable fashion taste.
item.content:encoded:
She's no stranger to turning heads with her enviable figure and impeccable fashion taste.

And on Wednesday, Shanina Shaik had all eyes on her again as she and her husband, Gregory 'DJ Ruckus' Andrews, hosted the IL MAKIAGE launch week party in New York City.

The former Victoria's Secret model looked spectacular in a short black leather mini skirt, which flaunted her trim and very toned pins.

Equally eye-catching was Shanina's stunning top.

Combining bell sleeves with a large shoulder cut that teased a hint of skin and cleavage, Shanina's blouse complemented her skirt perfectly.

The brunette beauty completed her smouldering look with a high ponytail, a chic black clutch bag, and some fancy black heels.

One person in attendance who only had eyes for Shanina was her event co-host and husband, DJ Ruckus. 

The 34-year-old was all smiles as he looked dashing in an army green coloured collared shirt.

The performer also rocked some trendy black jeans and a pair of fashionable black sneakers.

The IL MAKIAGE launch party wasn't the only event this week attended by Shanina in which all eyes were on her. 

The model attended the CFDA Fashion Awards in New York City on Monday, where she wowed everyone by wearing a tiny tassel playsuit by designer Kobi Halperin.

It's been a busy week for the model, who returned from an idyllic Mexico trip with her husband only recently.

Having been engaged since 2016, the Melbourne beauty and DJ Ruckus tied the knot just over a month ago.
item.dc:abstract: She's no stranger at turning heads with her enviable figure and impeccable fashion taste. And on Wednesday, Shanina Shaik turned heads yet again as she and her husband, Gregory 'DJ Ruckus' Andrews, hosted the IL MAKIAGE launch week party in New York City. The former Victoria's Secret model looked spectacular in a short black skirt that features a fashionable pocket on the left hip.

item.title: Here come the WAGs! The wives and girlfriends of the NSW Blues Queensland Maroons show their support ahead of the opening State Of Origin clash
item.description: They are the supportive wives and girlfriends of the NSW Blues Origin team.
item.content:encoded:
They are the supportive wives and girlfriends of the NSW Blues and Queensland Maroons Origin teams.

And the ladies have shown their support for their partners in the countdown to kick-off at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Wednesday.

Among the women gearing up for the first State Of Origin game include Kellie Rose, the wife of Penrith Panthers star Tyrone Peachey.

Scroll down for video 

She took to Instagram to share a photo of herself and the couple's one-year-old daughter Isla checking out Melbourne's famous street art.

The supportive wife is also in the Victorian capital with her friend and fellow Blues WAG Jessica Maloney, who is the wife of Penrith star James Maloney.

She brought their children - son Kade, eight, and daughter Layla Jade, six - along to the Melbourne Museum ahead of their father's big game.

Elsewhere, Elle Marie Vaughan, the wife of St. George Illawarra Dragons prop Paul Vaughan, shared a glamorous selfie with a gal pal after they jetted to Melbourne.

And the partners of the Queensland Maroons team were just as supportive, travelling to the city to watch their loved ones.

Former Miss Australia Courtney Thorpe, who is dating Maroons prop Jarrod Wallace, made the trip with the couple's two young daughters.

The brunette bombshell, clad in a glamorous pink ensemble, lovingly documented their kids doing 'ballet practice' in their hotel reception ahead of the game. 

Meanwhile, Taylor Brunton - the girlfriend of Coen Hess - was cutting it fine as she travelled to Melbourne on Wednesday.

The 21-year-old ensured she dressed up for the occasion, donning a chic black pea coat and skinny jeans in an Instagram snap that she captioned: 'Come on Qld!' 

Hot on her tails was Andrew McCullough's wife Carlie, who shared a smitten snap of her beau alongside the words: 'I love you.'

It comes after Daily Mail Australia revealed the new generation of rugby league WAGs accompanying the Blues' relatively inexperienced Origin side.

With backgrounds ranging from law to construction, there is definitely more to these photogenic women that meets eye.

Kat Hubner - Tom Trbojevic's girlfriend

Kat Hubner began dating Manly-born footy star Tom Trbojevic, 21, last year.

The budding foodie, who works in administration at a construction company, was born in Queensland but insists she has 'definitely converted' to New South Wales.   

'I wasn't a big league fan before Tom and I dated, but I always watched Origin. There is a real social aspect to the game,' she told The Daily Telegraph last week.

'My family have all had a talking to and I think everyone is on the same page now supporting New South Wales!'

Kat revealed that she and Tom, who is one of the youngest men at camp, were at a family dinner when he got the call confirming he was part of the Origin side.

Celebrating her boyfriend's triumph, she wrote on Instagram on Tuesday: 'Proud as punch! Congratulations! Couldn't be happier for you.'

Elle Marie Vaughan - Paul Vaughan's wife

Elle Marie Vaughan, 26, has been dating St. George Illawarra Dragons prop Paul Vaughan since Year 10, with the childhood sweethearts tying the knot in January this year.

Paying tribute to Paul on his 27th birthday earlier this year, Elle described the sportsman as 'beautiful, loyal, caring and fun'.

'I'm forever grateful for you, to be married and supported in life by such a beautiful, loyal, caring and fun man is everything I could have ever wished for,' she wrote. 

She added: 'That smile of yours is infectious and I love everything about you.'

Elle, who is a member of the legal team at the University of Wollongong, revealed the couple have been dreaming of Origin for years.

She said it was an 'amazing moment' when Paul made the team, adding that she was 'so stoked' for him.

Alyce Taylor - Jack De Berlin's girlfriend 

Sharing in their vicarious joy is Elle's good friend Alyce Taylor, whose boyfriend Jack De Belin also got his first call-up to play for the Blues.

The couples have clearly bonded over the years, with Alyce and Jack helping to celebrate Elle and Paul's wedding at a resort near Bouddi National Park.

Alyce regularly posts loved-up snaps with Dragon's lock Jack on social media, and recently sang his praises on his 27th birthday.

'Happy birthday to my darling,' she wrote on Instagram. 'You are one of a kind! Love doing life with you, there's never a dull moment.'

Speaking on the subject of Jack's Origin news, Alyce admitted she had grown up watching AFL, but has now become a committed 'league fan'.

Courtney Blaine - Damien Cook's fiancée

Courtney, 24, got engaged to South Sydney Rabbitohs hooker Damien in New York's Central Park in October 2016 after six-and-a-half years of dating. 

At the time, Damien said excitedly: 'This beautiful girl has agreed to marry me. I'm not sure why she said yes, but I'm glad she did.'

On being selected for the Blues, Damien remained humble and thanked his Rabbitohs teammates for getting him on the team. 

'I put it down to my teammates at Souths,' Damien told Fox Sports on Tuesday.

'You see how well our forward pack is going and, for a player like me to make the Blues, it is the team at Souths that got me here.

'So I'm really thankful for what the boys have done for me this year in allowing me to play consistent footy.'

Kellie Rose - Tyrone Peachey's wife

Kellie is married to Penrith Panthers player Tyrone, and the pair are proud parents to one-year-old daughter Isla.

Reflecting on the news that Tyrone, 26, had been selected for the Blues, Kellie declared: 'Dreams come true!'

She added of his career: 'I have loved this crazy ride and watching you achieve and live out your dreams.'

Tyrone admitted that he was nervous ahead of the Blues announcement and was feeling 'stressed' beforehand. 

'It's awesome, a surreal feeling,' Peachey told NSWRL.com.au. 'I still can't believe it.'  

'I was stressed all day and when I got the call it was a massive sigh of relief, I was pumped, I couldn't stop smiling. All the hard work has paid off and I get to play Origin Wednesday.'

And the ladies have shown their support for their partners in the countdown to kick-off at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Wednesday. Among the women gearing up for the first State Of Origin game include Kellie Rose, the wife of Penrith Panthers star Tyrone Peachey.

item.title: Charlie Hunnam cuts a casual figure in plaid shirt and newsboy cap while grabbing groceries in LA
item.description: He and girlfriend Morgan McNelis have been together for 13 years. And Charlie Hunnam was spotted solo on Tuesday while rocking a casual look.
item.content:encoded:
He and girlfriend Morgan McNelis have been together for 13 years.

And Charlie Hunnam was spotted solo on Tuesday while rocking a casual look.

The 38-year-old was buying groceries at Bristol Farms in West Hollywood.

The hunky actor rocked a blue and red plaid shirt tucked into a pair of dark jeans.

He finished the look in trainers and a flat cap. 

The King Arthur star shared with ET last year how he keeps the romance alive between the two.

'I subscribe to, like, not necessarily giving a big Christmas present, a big birthday present, or doing any giant outlandish romantic gestures,' he said.

'I try to keep it consistent. Like, small amount of romance all the time. That's my strategy.

'Like, cooking, like going out, buying her favorite groceries and cooking the meal that my lady likes. I'm an excellent cook,' he added. 

'It's the thing I enjoy doing the most in my free time. If I'm cooking for my girlfriend, she loves pasta so if I'm going to spoil her, I'll go out and make some pasta.'

Before meeting Morgana, Hunnam was married to his Undeclared co-star Katharine Towne for three years until their 2002 divorce.  

Charlie recently wrapped up filming for the movie Triple Frontier in Hawaii.
item.dc:abstract: He and girlfriend Morgan McNelis have been together for 13 years. And Charlie Hunnam was spotted solo on Tuesday while rocking a casual look. The 38-year-old was buying groceries at Bristol Farms in West Hollywood.

item.title: Stranger Things' David Harbour reveals he was committed to mental asylum by his parents
item.description: He became a hero to all by protecting Eleven from mind probings at Hawkins Lab. And David Harbour has revealed his own mental state was under heavy observation when he was a youngster.
item.content:encoded:
He became a hero to all by protecting Eleven from mind probings at Hawkins Lab.

And David Harbour has revealed his own mental state was under heavy observation when he was a youngster, having been committed to an asylum.

The 43-year-old revealed on Marc Marron's WTF podcast, as reported by TooFab, that his parents sent him there.

He revealed he was eventually diagnosed as bipolar at age 25, after having a manic episode that was at the time linked to his preoccupation with spirituality.

 'Here's the interesting thing — something I've never truly spoken about publicly,' the Stranger Things star said. 

'I was actually into this Catholicism thing … and I was sober for like a year and a half, I was 25, and I actually did have a manic episode. I was diagnosed as bipolar.'  

'I really had like a bit of a break where I thought I was in connection with God...[But] I wasn't really in connection.

'It was like I had all the answers suddenly,' he recalled.

When the host asked if he was on drugs at the time, he replied no; because he realized he 'didn't really need them' 

'I have a capacity to see 'the elves' in the corners of the room if I really allow myself to go there,' he added. 'Yeah so I was actually — by my parents — taken into a mental asylum.'

He continued: I have to say I have one thing to say about the mental asylum. I've romanticized two things in my life and both have fallen short. One is being in a mental asylum. Really not as fun as you think it is. No but you do have a romantic idea of it — [like] "you're a genius" — and it just ends up being sad and smells like shit. 

'And the other thing was boating. I just recently went out on a ship in open water and I'd read Moby Dick a million times and it really is not as sexy. It's very similar to the mental asylum experience.

He said after his bipolar diagnosis, that was 'when the drugs came in.' 

'I've been medicated bipolar for a long time. And I've had problems going on and off,' he said. 'I've had a struggle. Going on and off the medications.'  

He admitted questioning himself, thinking 'you're not the artist that you could be... you think you're not digging as deep as you could be.'

Harbour contined: 'The funny thing about my brain is every time I've had an episode like that it's coupled with spirituality. Generally, people are like "I need to meditate more" or "I need to get into yoga."

'And I need to like eat a cheeseburger and just like smoke cigarettes and hang out. Because like the minute I get close to that – what I consider a flame – of like "the answers" and the mysticism, and I'm like "completely present", it's like I'm out of my mind. So if I write the self-help book it's going to be like 'sit on the couch and play some video games.'"

'You let your mind go you're like a few days shy of walking down the street wearing robes,' Marc joked.

'No joke,' Harbour confirmed. 'Like 'Come join me!'
item.dc:abstract: He became a hero to all by protecting Eleven from mind probings at Hawkins Lab. And David Harbour has revealed his own mental state was under heavy observation when he was a youngster, having been committed to an asylum. The 43-year-old revealed on Marc Marron's WTF podcast, as reported by TooFab , that his parents sent him there.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Sotoodeh
item.mi:shortTitle: David Harbour reveals he was committed to mental asylum by his parents

item.title: Channel Nine star and Footy Show host Erin Molan welcomes baby girl called Eliza Emily Ogilvy - just in time for the first State of Origin
item.description: The couple have named their bundle of joy Eliza Emily Ogilvy.
item.content:encoded:
Erin Molan has given birth to a baby girl.  

The Footy Show host, 35, and her fiancé Sean Ogilvy, welcomed their first child on Wednesday morning. 

The couple have named their bundle of joy Eliza Emily Ogilvy.

'Everyone at Nine is so happy for Erin and Sean and the safe arrival of beautiful Eliza,' Erin's spokesperson told Nine.

'We wish them well for the start of the next exciting phase, and look forward to meeting the new Blues supporter when she is ready. Congratulations from all.'

Erin previously revealed that her due date was around one of the biggest days on the Australian sporting calendar -  the first game of the 2018 State of Origin series.  

And baby Eliza was right on the mark, arriving the same morning as the opener.

'I’m due to give birth around State Of Origin I,' she told hit105’s Stav, Abby and Matt back in March.   

She joked: 'My timing is horrendous, as per usual with most things in life.'

Chuckling, she predicted at the time: 'I'm sure work's really happy with my timing.'

While it's been confirmed Erin and baby Eliza are happy and healthy, the Nine journalist had a few hiccups throughout her pregnancy.

Back in February, Erin was taken to hospital after collapsing and hitting her head whilst working at Channel Nine's Sydney studios. 

She also suffered from hyperemesis gravidarum, commonly known as extreme morning sickness.

And then while she was heavily pregnant in May she was rushed to hospital after suffering a shocking tumble in a Sydney shopping centre. 

'The baby is totally healthy, as am I! Just an unfortunate but very common reaction to the vaccines,' she notified concerned fans at the time.   

Erin announced her engagement to fiance' Sean while hosting the Footy Show last April, and revealed she was expecting a child on the show in December.

Preparing for the bub's arrival earlier this week, Erin shared a glimpse of her baby haul for her adorable girl on Monday to Instagram.

Erin gave her followers a tour of her various baby-related purchases, including a changing table, nappies, a blanket and a rocker. 

A new pram, by Bugaboo, appeared to be specially made and could cost up to $2,000, according to the company's website. 

Erin joked she felt anxious about becoming a mother earlier this year.

'I just keep Googling "how to keep a baby alive after birth" ' and not much comes up so I'm totally stuffed, I don't know what I'm doing,' she said during a past radio interview.

'Hopefully instinct kicks in but we'll see... It hasn't served me well in the past.'

Erin said she does not expect to take a great deal of maternity leave and will return to work, 'very quickly'.

The Footy Show host told The Sunday Telegraph earlier this year: 'I think I will be able to go back very quickly because I’ll be able to be a full-time mum at home; I can do my prep from there, and then be able to go into work for a few hours at night.'

She had previously stated she intends to have a nanny accompany her to the Nine News studios for her 6pm sports bulletin shift.

In spite of Erin's ambitious post-baby plans she confessed other mothers may not concur with her school of thought.

Her statement came after she spoke to Nine Honey about the pressures of being a new mother in the celebrity spotlight.

'I don't think that it affects me, people saying things about me or judging me, because I've had so much of it over 12 or 13 years in television,' she said.

'But they say when it involves a child it's a different thing, so I'm a little bit anxious about how it will be perceived.'
item.dc:abstract: Erin Molan has given birth to a baby girl. The Footy Show host, 35, and her fiance Sean Ogilvy, welcomed their first child on Wednesday morning. The couple have called their bundle of joy Eliza Emily Ogilvy. Erin previously revealed that her due date was around one of the biggest days on the Australian sporting calendar, the State of Origin.

item.title: Kendra Wilkinson shares details of her fight with ex Hank Baskett in real-time via Twitter
item.description: The Girls Next Door said Baskett, who played wide receiver for the Philadelphia Eagles, was blaming her for the end of his career on the football field.
item.content:encoded:
Kendra Wilkinson shared on Twitter Tuesday the details of a fight she had with ex Hank Baskett, but later deleted the tweets.

The 32-year-old wrote, 'Why is Hank recording me right now. Please tell him to leave me alone and stop.'

The Girls Next Door said that the 35-year-old Baskett, who played wide receiver for the Philadelphia Eagles, Minnesota Vikings and Indianapolis Colts over a five-year NFL career, was blaming her for the end of his time on the gridiron. 

Hank was 'blaming me for cheating on me while I was pregnant,' with their four-year-old daughter Alijah in 2014, wrote Kendra, who also shares an eight-year-old son Hank IV with the NFL alum. (Hank denied the accusations.)

The former Playboy Mansion resident said Hank intentionally recorded her to push her buttons.

'I'm minding my business and after I tell him to leave me alone he disrespects me, I'm trying to get out my house fast,' she wrote. 'I'm beyond sad. But recording me is my trigger.'

The San Diego native tweeted that she 'tried so hard' to keep things cordial with Hank, but the two continue to have a rocky relationship.

'I did everything by the book and loved and I get s*** on. I'm so sorry for u all to feel awkward rt now. When I was being recorded I felt threatened. Have a good day.'

She later wrote: 'When u feel like u give the best of yourself 24/7 and someone trying to take the best of u... it's hard to breathe. Love you all.'

Hank's been 'taking big digs at Kendra to get under her skin,' an insider told E! News about the tension between the two, as he 'knows what bothers her most.'

Said the source: 'He sees that she is trying to move on and wants to date again, and it's something that triggers him. It has been an ongoing battle between the two.'

'A lot of animosity' has surfaced 'a lot throughout the divorce process,' according to the insider.

Kendra in April filed to end her eight-year marriage to the athlete.
item.dc:abstract: Kendra Wilkinson shared on Twitter Tuesday the details of a fight she had with ex Hank Baskett, but later deleted the anger-fueled tweets. The 32-year-old wrote, 'Why is Hank recording me right now. Please tell him to leave me alone and stop.' The Girls Next Door said that the 35-year-old Baskett, who played wide receiver for the Philadelphia Eagles, Minnesota Vikings and Indianapolis Colts over a five-year NFL career, was blaming her for the end of his time on the gridiron.

item.title: Something to tell us? Married At First Sight's Davina Rankin parades a VERY impressive sparkler at Brisbane Airport... just two months after finding love with boyfriend Jaxon Manuel
item.description: After being left single from her stint as Married At First Sight's 'villain' earlier this year, Davina Rankin has finally found love in the arms of cafe owner Jaxon Manuel.
item.content:encoded:
Following her Married At First Sight 'cheating' scandal, Davina Rankin found her happily ever after with café owner Jaxon Manuel.

And on Wednesday, the personal trainer flashed a new diamond ring as she strolled through Brisbane Airport.

The 27-year-old's sparkler took pride of place on her left hand as she approached her boarding gate before catching a flight to America.

Scroll down for video 

It's unknown if the ring was a special gift from Jaxon, who Davina confirmed as her new boyfriend in April.

It's unclear if the couple are newly engaged, however the ring was worn on her middle finger.

Davina previously told Daily Mail Australia about her relationship: 'Jax and I have been friends for years but the timing now is just perfect for the both of us.'

Jaxon did not appear to be join Davina on her flight to America.

Meanwhile, a source told Daily Mail Australia on Wednesday that her trip stateside will be a working holiday.

'Davina is going to the US for some rest and relaxation, but she's also keen to explore other opportunities while she's there,' said the insider. 

'Her friends wouldn't be surprised if she ended up doing a photo shoot or some reality TV auditions. '

'Obviously, she won't be doing any dating shows because she's dating Jaxon,' the source continued. 

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Davina Rankin for comment.

And on Wednesday, the personal trainer flashed a new diamond ring as she strolled through Brisbane Airport. The 27-year-old's sparkler took pride of place on her left hand as she approached her boarding gate before catching a flight to America.

item.title: Gigi Hadid confirms Zayn Malik reunion with loved-up Instagram Story snapshot
item.description: They broke up in March, but were glimpsed kissing at the end of April. And this Tuesday evening, Gigi Hadid and Zayn Malik went Instagram official with their reunion, cozying up to each other on her Story.
item.content:encoded:
They broke up in March, but were glimpsed kissing at the end of April.

And this Tuesday evening, Gigi Hadid and Zayn Malik went Instagram official with their reunion, cozying up to each other on her Story.

Gigi, 23, shot an enigmatic stare at her phone camera as the ex-One Direction bandmate leaned over and appeared to plant a kiss on her cheek.

Though Zayn's face was not visible to the camera, the Bradford-born 25-year-old could be identified by a chessboard tattoo on his left forearm.

He appeared to have gone shirtless for the snap, while Gigi was in a cleavage-baring black outfit for what she wrote was an 'after party.'

Earlier that evening, she had posed up a storm with fellow supermodel Lily Aldridge at the New York City premiere of the new film Ocean's 8.

Gigi dated Zayn for about two years before their breakup went public.

Shortly after Gigi and Zayn publicly revealed their split, he had multiple tattoos applied in the span of a week, including the number 25 - his age - on his neck.

As early as this January, Zayn could be spotted on Gigi's Instagram page sporting a chest tattoo of what uncannily appeared to be her eyes.

At the end of April, DailyMail.com exclusively obtained photos of Gigi and Zayn sharing a kiss on a New York City sidewalk - she holding a bag from her own line.

Zayn was bald at the time - this being before he adopted the platinum blonde cropped hairdo he sported in Monday evening's Instagram Stories photo.

Gigi is the elder sister of fellow supermodel Bella Hadid and lesser-known model Anwar Hadid - as well as the daughter of ex-Real Housewife Yolanda Hadid.

Anwar, 18, was glimpsed this week sharing a smooch with Gigi's pal Kendall Jenner, 22.
item.dc:abstract: They broke up in March, but were glimpsed kissing at the end of April. Gigi, 23, shot an enigmatic stare at her phone camera as the ex-One Direction bandmate leaned over and appeared to plant a kiss on her cheek.

item.title: Abby Lee Miller undergoes another MRI and emergency surgery amid cancer battle
item.description: 'After another 2 hour MRI this morning, the pros thought I needed one more quick little emergency surgery!' she wrote alongside a shot of her arm rigged with an intravenous line.
item.content:encoded:
Abby Lee Miller was forced to undergo another emergency surgery.

The 51-year-old, who is battling newly-diagnosed cancer, revealed on Instagram on Tuesday that she was back in hospital.

 'After another 2 hour MRI this morning, the pros thought I needed one more quick little emergency surgery!' she wrote alongside a shot of her arm rigged with an intravenous line.  

'Ugh! I’m in recovery now and texting so everything must be ok,just hiccups in my plans! 

She continued: 'I’m on a tight schedule; shooting two projects and I need to get out of here and on with my life!!! Please keep me in your prayers. I’m grateful for all the well wishes!'

The Dance Moms star was recently diagnosed with Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma, shortly before her release from prison.

Last month a source told People that the reality star was 'losing it' and was in a 'really bad place'. 

'She has two more chemo sessions to go, but she's in a really bad place - mentally and emotionally. She's really losing it,' they said.  

In April Abby underwent a four-hour emergency operation shortly after her prison release, on what doctors first thought was a spinal infection. 

It's been a difficult few years for Miller, who had been in custody at Victorville Federal Correctional Institution from July until late last month in connection with her bankruptcy fraud conviction.

She lost 100 pounds while in custody while at the penitentiary.

In March, she began staying at a Long Beach, California halfway house, where she was slated to stay until May 25.

item.title: Hamish Blake finally reveals the reason he's spent SIX months growing his beard... after relentless questioning from fans
item.description: Hamish Blake has finally revealed the reason he's been growing his facial hair for SIX months, as he stepped out for Beard Season's winter launch over the weekend.
item.content:encoded:
Hamish Blake began growing his beard on January 1st. 

And now, after relentless questioning from fans, the comedian has revealed the reason he's been keeping clear of the razor. 

Over the weekend, the 36-year-old star stepped out for Beard Season's Launch Party - an initiative which sees men grow their facial hair during winter in order to raise awareness of skin cancer.

Hamish joined 110 other attendees at the event - including fellow funnyman Michael 'Wippa' Wiplfi.

The motley crew braved the elements, dressing up in nautical-inspired outfits and boarding a boat on Sydney Harbour. 

Hamish opted for a fun sailor's uniform on the night, complete with epaulets and medallions.

At one point, the star was seen enjoying a drink with Beard Season founder Jimmy Niggles, whose famous bushy beard has even attracted the attention of billionaire Richard Branson.

The Virgin co-founder - who has a net worth of US$5billion - even invited Jimmy to his private Nekker Island,  where he informed him that he had had his own skin checked after becoming aware of Beard Season. 

Jimmy came up with the initiative six years ago, after tragically losing a close friend to melanoma at the tender age of 26. 

And now Hamish is one of Beard Season's biggest enthusiasts.

In a post shared to Instagram on Sunday, the radio and TV star shared a snap alongside Jimmy accompanied by a lengthy caption.

'I came across the incredible movement started by the man pictured, Jimmy, whose sole aim is to grow beards as conversation starters to spread the word about getting a skin cancer check at your GP no matter your age or how sure you are your skin is fine. 

'Too many people find something too late, Beard Season wants to make skin checks for you and your loved ones top of mind so that doesn’t happen. 

'As a former pale kid who is now a current pale adult with a religious skin check regime, I couldn’t have been happier to support the launch of Beard Season 2018 last night.'

Beard Season's Facebook page is currently calling on men across the country to grow their facial hair.

'Make sure you register and help us raise a million bucks this winter to fund a free national skincheck program because it really does work. Because together, we can outgrow melanoma,' a recent status read. 

https://beardseason.com.au/home 

https://www.facebook.com/ThisIsBeardSeason/

item.title: Jared Leto 'to reprise his role as the Joker in standalone film'... two years after Suicide Squad
item.description: His introduction in 2016's Suicide Squad fell a bit flat. But Jared Leto is hoping to deliver in his very own Joker movie.
item.content:encoded:
He played the character in 2016's Suicide Squad.

 And Jared Leto will be getting his own Joker movie.

Warner Bros has given the green light to a standalone movie, expanding on Leto interpretation's of him, Variety reported on Tuesday.

The studio announced last fall that it was developing a Joker origin tale with  Hangover director Todd Phillips.

Joaquin Phoenix was tapped to play the lead; however Warner insisted Leto's version was not being scrapped.

Instead, Phillips film would fall under a new 'origins' banner which would be completely separate from the established DC cinematic universe.

This in turn would allow different actors take the same roles, but different versions.

There is no production date, and no writer attached as of yet. 

The Oscar-winner had some big shoes to fill, following fan-adored interpretations from Heath Ledger, Jack Nicholson, Cesar Romero and even Mark Hamill's animated version.
item.dc:abstract: His introduction in 2016's Suicide Squad fell a bit flat. But Jared Leto is hoping to deliver in his very own Joker movie. Warner Bros has given the green light to a standalone movie, expanding on Leto interpretation's of him, Variety reported on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Sotoodeh

item.title: Hilaria Baldwin wears black lingerie and dotes on baby Romeo calling him a 'king' in Instagram video
item.description: The devoted mom shared more images of 19-day-old Romeo on Tuesday, bragging he is 'already accomplishing great thing' along with a gold trophy emoji and the banner 'king'.
item.content:encoded:
She gave birth to her fourth child and third son on May 17.

And Hilaria Baldwin can't stop showing him off on her Instagram.

The devoted mom shared more images of 19-day-old Romeo on Tuesday, bragging he is 'already accomplishing great thing' along with a gold trophy emoji and the banner 'king'.

The tot is seen wrapped up in a fluffy blanket.

Hilaria, 34, who wed actor Alec Baldwin, 60, in 2012, wears black lacy lingerie in the video she posted to Instagram.

The naked infant is pictured cuddling up to her and snuggling against her breast

The yoga instructor has snapped back into shape with seeming remarkable ease.

On Monday, she shared a selfie to her Instagram bragging that she's now back in her skinny jeans.

'Hello my old jean friends,' the Spanish-born brunette 34-year-old yogi wrote alongside the snap showing her in the tight denims paired with a fitted turtleneck.

Hilaria dressed things up with nude heels, diamond rings and a coat for the outdoors.

Later on, she shared a pre-running selfie where she was equipped with a fanny pack, wireless headphones and comfortable jogging clothes.

In addition to baby Romeo, Hilaria and Alec are parents to daughter Carmen, four, and sons Rafael, two, and Leonardo, one.

The 30 Rock and SNL star also has a daughter Ireland, 22, with his ex-wife Kim Basinger.

And Tuesday was a very sad day for Ireland, who is forging a career as a model.

She shared with her Instagram followers that her beloved Husky Balto had passed away.

She posted a video clip of the dog along with the message: 'heaven got a really incredible doggo today. thank you for bringing me all the joy you did and i’m glad i got a shot at being your momma. i love you Balto.'

item.title: How much Married At First Sight stars are REALLY paid: Nasser Sultan reveals the surprisingly low amount cast members received for 'living expenses' and admits they even had to buy their own FOOD
item.description: Married At First Sight contestants put their lives on hold for up to four months and risk destroying their reputations for TV ratings gold.
item.content:encoded:
Married At First Sight contestants put their lives on hold for up to four months and risk destroying their reputations for TV ratings gold.

But how much are cast members actually paid to take part in the show?

There is no salary, per se, however participants do receive daily 'living expenses' that are expected to cover food and bills.

Scroll down for video 

Nasser Sultan told Stav, Abby & Matt on Wednesday that he only received $150 per day in exchange for appearing on the show. 

'Out of that, we've got to buy our own food and we've got to pay our own bills, so it's really not much money,' he said.

'When [the Network is] making millions of dollars out of something, it's not much money.'

Nasser, 51, added: 'People think we got thousands of dollars, we really didn't. 

'Other contestants, I believe, negotiated and got a bit more. Like, they got $300 or $200 a day.

'But I was getting $150 a day. Mate, I have mortgage. We couldn't work for three or four months.'

Nasser said that he accepted the low living expenses, but feels annoyed because he's since been blacklisted by Channel Nine.

'I love the show and chose to be on it. But at least do something, ring up every now and then,' he said.

Nasser has claimed Nine's publicity department dropped him for taking part in unapproved media interviews.

He is also not invited to the upcoming Logie Awards, despite the fact Married At First Sight has been nominated.  

'We made the show, we made the ratings... and we get snubbed,' he said. 'I think it's an outrage.'

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Channel Nine for comment.

item.title: Australia's rival TV chefs call a temporary truce to cook a charity dinner in Melbourne - but fans don't expect the peace to last
item.description: But a temporary truce was called on Monday as chefs Matt Preston, George Calombaris, Gary Mehigan and Manu Feildel joined forces to cook a feast for charity SecondBite at Melbourne's MCG.
item.content:encoded:
They are among Australia's top chefs and are bitter rivals with their competing TV cooking shows MasterChef and My Kitchen Rules.

But a temporary truce was called on Monday as chefs Matt Preston, George Calombaris, Gary Mehigan and Manu Feildel joined forces to cook a feast for charity SecondBite at Melbourne's MCG.

In a rare display of unity, MasterChef judge Matt posted a group shot of the event to Instagram, with the caption: 'The stellar culinary line up.'

In another shot - this time from the kitchen at the event - Matt wrote: 'Back of house at the #wastenotwantnot dinner at the MCG for @secondbiteorg ... United for a great cause!'

'I love that Manu is coming down (from Sydney) for this. We’re all friends in the food world coming together for a great cause,' Matt told the Herald Sun recently. 

SecondBite distributes surplus fresh food to communities around the country.

It was something of a reunion for Manu and Gary, who appeared together on Network Ten's Boys Weekend cooking show in the mid-to-late 2000s. 

Fans of the rival cooking shows however are not expecting the truce to last, as they have a history of public spats.

Speaking to Confidential in May, MasterChef judge Matt Preston appeared to throw shade at MKR, saying he had a 'no d**kheads' policy for his show's upcoming season.

'You can get drama by picking d**kheads but over the years we have picked less and less d**kheads,' he said.

MKR at the time had controversially booted contestants Sonya and Hadil off the show for 'bullying'. 

And last year, MKR's Manu hit back at the suggestion his celebrity status has taken over, having not worked in a restaurant for years.

'Why should I stop calling myself a chef?' the 44-year-old told the Daily Telegraph.

'Can you call yourself a doctor if you don't practise? I think you can,' Manu explained.
item.dc:abstract: They are among Australia's top chefs and are bitter rivals with their competing TV cooking shows MasterChef and My Kitchen Rules. But a temporary truce was called on Monday as chefs Matt Preston, George Calombaris, Gary Mehigan and Manu Feildel joined forces to cook a feast for charity SecondBite at Melbourne's MCG. In a rare display of unity, MasterChef judge Matt posted a group shot of the event to Instagram, with the caption: 'The stellar culinary line up.'
item.dc:creator: Nick Hadley
item.mi:shortTitle: Australia's rival TV chefs call a truce to cook for charity

item.title: Sophia Bush and Jaime King rock colorful dresses at Incredibles 2 premiere in Los Angeles
item.description: Sophia Bush and Jaime King showed off their beauty as the walked the red carpet for the premiere of the Incredibles 2. Both appeared donning colorful outfits featuring bold patterns.
item.content:encoded:
They're two of the most stunning women on the planet.

And both Sophia Bush, 35, and Jaime King, 39, showed off their beauty as the walked the red carpet for the premiere of the Incredibles 2 in Los Angeles.

Both appeared donning colorful outfits featuring bold patterns.

Sophia, who voices Voyd in the new Disney Pixar animated feature, wore a sparkling turquoise number featuring lines of black stars.

The shining garment stopped at the One Tree Hill star's knees, showcasing her enviable calves.

Open-toed black heels added a few more inches, and she carried a small black clutch.

Her long brown locks went from dark to light as the fell in loose waves over her shoulders.

Jaime opted opted for a pretty orange, foral-print number with billowy sleeves that reached down to her ankles.

White stilettos added a touch of elegance to the fun, summery ensemble.

Her long blonde tresses cascaded to her shoulders in broad curls, and she wore striking red lipstick, giving the outfit another classic touch. 

Samuel L. Jackson, 69, who plays Frozone in the flick, donned a deep blue ensemble featured a suit with red stripes and a- newsboy cap.

He was joined by his wife of 38 years LaTanya Richardson, who stars as the voice of Honey Best.

Patton Oswalt was also in attendance with his wife Meredith Salenger as well as his daughter Alice.

He looked snazzy in a steel blue suit with a white shirt and grey pocket square. 

Craig T. Nelson, the voice of Mr. Incredible, looked casual as he attended the premiere in an all lack ensemble that included a comfortable-looking zippered jacket.

Huck Milner, who stars as the voice of Dash, look sharped in a summer-y blue suit.

Holly Hunter, who stars as the voice of Elastigirl, donned a pretty pink, white, and red floral dress as she smiled for the cameras on the carpet. 

Jenna Ortega, 15, went with a racing-inspired look as she wore a matching skirt and top with retro white sunglasses on top of her head. 

Stephen Boss and his adorable family of Allison Holker, Maddox Laurel Boss, and Weslie Fowler were also in attendance. 

The carpet was certainly a family affair as Tiffani Thiessen appeared with her daughter.

Mario Lopez dressed in jeans and a button down shirt as he opted for a casual look while appearing with his wife, Courtney Mazza, and their two kids.

Jana Kramer was seen smiling from ear to ear as she arrived with her husband, Mike Caussin, and their child Jolie.

The 34-year-old country crooner donned a one piece army green ensemble that showed off her lithe legs. 

John Ratzenberger, who voices The Underminer in the movie, wore a black pinstripe suit along with a lavender suit, bring some old school flair to the affair.

Catherine Keener, who stars as the voice of Evelyn Deavor in the flick, arrived wearing a green and black dress with a black coat on top.

Bob Odenkirk, who plays the voice of Winston Deavor, arrived donning a sweater on top of grey jeans.
item.dc:abstract: They're two of the most stunning women on the planet. And both Sophia Bush, 35, and Jaime King, 39, showed off their beauty as the walked the red carpet for the premiere of the Incredibles 2 in Los Angeles. Both appeared donning colorful outfits featuring bold patterns.

item.title: John Travolta snaps a picture of his daughter Ella Bleu on the set of the upcoming movie Poison Rose
item.description: The Gotti star showed a camera view of his 18-year-old daughter with wife Kelly Preston as she appeared a scene in the forthcoming Noir thriller.
item.content:encoded:
A proud John Travolta took to Instagram on Wednesday to show his daughter Ella Bleu Travolta as she performed before the camera on the set of his upcoming movie, Poison Rose.

'First day of shooting with my daughter Ella Bleu for the film Poison Rose,' the A-list actor, 64, wrote, adding the hashtag, '#EllaTravolta.'

The Gotti star showed a camera view of his 18-year-old daughter with wife Kelly Preston as she appeared in a scene in the forthcoming Noir thriller.

Scroll below for video 

Production on the George Gallo-directed movie, which features a cast including Morgan Freeman, Brendan Fraser, Famke Janssen and Robert Patrick, has been ongoing in Savannah, Georgia amid the controversy surrounding Freeman, 81, stemming from a CNN report he sexually harassed or was inappropriate towards women.

In February, Travolta took spoke to Extra about Ella's role in the movie, coming on the heels of her performance in his latest release, Gotti.

'My daughter is stunning and we're planning to do a movie together,' the veteran actor told the program. 'Yes, called Poison Rose, and she plays my daughter, but I don't know she's my daughter.

'Although I look at her and she looks just like me, so it's going to be hard to play that, but that's next.'

Ella was at the side of her father and mother Kelly Preston, as well as her younger brother Ben, seven, at the Cannes Film Festival last month for the Gotti premiere. 

It was a sentimental occasion, marking the family's first red carpet walk in the nine years since the tragic death of Jett Travolta at 16 at the family's Bahamas vacation home in January of 2009.

The actor, in a 2014 interview in London, called Jett's death 'the worst thing that's ever happened in [his] life,' adding that he 'didn't know if [he] was going to make it' through the traumatic aftermath.

'Life was no longer interesting to me, so it took a lot to get me better,' said the family man, who credited the Church of Scientology for helping pave the road back.

'I will forever be grateful to Scientology for supporting me for two years solid, I mean Monday through Sunday,' Travolta said. 'They didn't take a day off, working through different angles of the techniques to get through grief and loss, and to make me feel that finally I could get through a day.'
item.dc:abstract: A proud John Travolta took to Instagram on Wednesday to show his daughter Ella Bleu Travolta as she performed before the camera on the set of his upcoming movie, Poison Rose. 'First day of shooting with my daughter Ella Bleu for the film Poison Rose,' the A-list actor, 64, wrote, adding the hashtag, '#EllaTravolta.' The Gotti star showed a camera view of his 18-year-old daughter with wife Kelly Preston as she appeared a scene in the forthcoming Noir thriller.
